page.title: 15HAZEL GROVE SPORTS CENTRE.
page.content: It was built in 1977 and was positioned near the school. This meant that facilities could be shared. It also meant that the school took priority over the public. In return, the school allows the public to use the school hall for judo and yoga classes. There are many courses held in the centre. The most popular is gymnastics on Saturday mornings. Martial Art courses are also popular because of the influence of T.V. films and people's increasing desire to learn self defence. There are twenty-two employees in the centre who not only look after the indoor facilities but also attend to the outside tennis courts, and football all-weather pitches. About 6,000 people use the centre every month, some have become famous athletes.
